intro: Hieracium valdefoliosum, commonly known as the Valdese hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
